meanings.definition: To reply or respond in conversation or argument.
meanings.sent1: When asked a question, she quickly rejoined with an answer.
meanings.sent2: I always rejoin with a smile when someone greets me.
meanings.sent3: During the debate, he tried to rejoin with a joke, but it fell flat.
meanings.sent4: Her witty comeback was like a boomerang, always ready to rejoin the conversation.
meanings.sent5: His ability to rejoin with clever remarks made him popular among his friends.

meanings.definition: To return to a place or group after being separated.
meanings.sent1: After getting lost in the park, she managed to rejoin her family.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was relieved to rejoin the main trail after taking a wrong turn.
meanings.sent3: The runaway dog finally decided to rejoin its owner after a long chase.
meanings.sent4: The scattered pieces of the puzzle seemed to magically rejoin into a complete picture.
meanings.sent5: The migrating birds will rejoin their flock when the weather gets colder.

meanings.sent1: He needed to rejoin the broken pieces of the toy to make it whole again.
meanings.sent2: The bridge collapsed, but the engineers worked quickly to rejoin the two ends.
meanings.sent3: The old friends planned to rejoin their efforts for a charity event.
meanings.sent4: The severed cable was carefully reconnected to rejoin the internet connection.
meanings.sent5: The artist used glue to rejoin the parts of the sculpture that had fallen apart.
